alert.note: Alert for Yavapai (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 08 at 4:20PM MST until August 08 at 6:45PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 645 PM MST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of Yavapai County in west central Arizona, near Wagoner. * WHEN...Until 645 PM MST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in creeks and normally dry washes is imminent or occurring. Dangerous flooding over low-water crossings. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 418 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated the heavy rain due to thunderstorms has moved out of the advised area. However, minor flooding is still ongoing or expected to begin shortly as water drains. Between 1 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Cellar Springs Creek, Cherry Creek, North Fork Cellar Springs Creek, Cottonwood Creek, Blind Indian Creek, Minnehaha Creek, Arrastre Creek, Milk Creek and Hassayampa River. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Wagoner. - Visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for more information on flood safety.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Remain alert for flooding even in locations not receiving rain. Normally dry washes, slot canyons and creeks can become raging killer currents in a matter of minutes, even from distant rainfall.
